intro: Sechiopsis tetraptera, commonly known as the four-winged sechiopsis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive four-winged fruits, which are adapted for wind dispersal. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces showy yellow flowers. Sechiopsis tetraptera is often found in disturbed habitats and can thrive in arid conditions.
